intro: Pseudognaphalium fastigiatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pink to reddish in color. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its foliage is covered in fine, cottony hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid conditions.
